GLM_FUNC_DECL uint64 glm::bitfieldInterleave (uint16 x, uint16 y, uint16 z, uint16 w)

Detailed Description

Allow to perform bit operations on integer values.

<glm/gtx/bit.hpp> need to be included to use these functionalities.

Function Documentation

GLM_FUNC_QUALIFIER uint64 glm::bitfieldInterleave ( uint16  x,
uint16  y,
uint16  z,
uint16  w 
) [inline]

Interleaves the bits of x, y, z and w. The first bit is the first bit of x followed by the first bit of y, the first bit of z and finally the first bit of w. The other bits are interleaved following the previous sequence.

See also:
GLM_GTX_bit

Definition at line 777 of file bit.inl.

00778         {
00779                 return detail::bitfieldInterleave<uint16, uint64>(x, y, z, w);
00780         }

GLM_FUNC_QUALIFIER genType glm::bitRevert ( genType const &  value  )  [inline]

Revert all bits of any integer based type.

See also:
GLM_GTX_bit

Definition at line 168 of file bit.inl.

00169         {
00170                 GLM_STATIC_ASSERT(std::numeric_limits<genType>::is_integer, "'bitRevert' only accept integer values");
00171 
00172                 genType Out = 0;
00173                 std::size_t BitSize = sizeof(genType) * 8;
00174                 for(std::size_t i = 0; i < BitSize; ++i)
00175                         if(In & (genType(1) << i))
00176                                 Out |= genType(1) << (BitSize - 1 - i);
00177                 return Out;
00178         }

Definition at line 153 of file bit.inl.

References glm::highestBitValue(), and glm::isPowerOfTwo().

00156         {
00157                 if(isPowerOfTwo(value))
00158                         return value;
00159 
00160                 genType prev = highestBitValue(value);
00161                 genType next = prev << 1;
00162                 return (next - value) < (value - prev) ? next : prev;
00163         }
